intro: Hieracium akjaurense, commonly known as the Akjaure hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, particularly in Georgia. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization.
